definition: too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.

sentences.english: It's not a decision you'll regret, even if L.A. winds up losing in a blowout.
sentences.chinese: 即使快船被虐，你也不會後悔這個決定。

sentences.english: Noda Take regret the pain, two people fall together.
sentences.chinese: 野田毅後悔痛苦，二人倒在了一起。

sentences.english: The girl deplores greatly to cry not to come out, but regrets again to also don't use.
sentences.chinese: 女孩心痛到哭不出來，可是再後悔也沒有用了。

sentences.english: OK, so don't make me do anything that I'll regret.
sentences.chinese: 那麼別逼我做令我後悔的事。

sentences.english: Sorry , you write on the blackboard , i understand but you speak i must think .
sentences.chinese: 這時的她在想，後悔以前怎麼就沒好好學英語呢？

sentences.english: All of us regret for the decision.
sentences.chinese: 我們都對那個決定感到後悔。

sentences.english: Think it over before you go so that you won't regret it later.
sentences.chinese: 你要先考慮清楚，免得吃後悔藥。

sentences.english: So be slow to take action or to make statements you might later regret...
sentences.chinese: 因此，別急着採取行動，或發表聲明，免得日後後悔。

sentences.english: I feel regretful for what I've done.
Love means never having to say you are sorry.
sentences.chinese: 愛，意味着永不說検罕後悔。

sentences.english: "You'll never regret it," I say finally.
I never saw her again,  nor I regret it.
sentences.chinese: 此後我再也沒見到過她，對此我一點兒也不後悔。

sentences.english: Only in this way you will not regret medicine to buy.
sentences.chinese: 只有這樣你纔不會去買後悔藥。

sentences.english: Xu felt that she had tied Liu down and repeatedly asked him, 'Are you regretful?
sentences.chinese: 徐認爲，她綁住劉下來，反覆問他，你是否有後悔？

sentences.english: At the moment, I have penitence pole.
It is better to be safe than sorry.

definition: to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
guilty conscience/to feel a twinge of guilt
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
unworthy/to let down/I'm sorry/excuse me/pardon me/if you please/sorry? (please repeat)
